00052 g2m::g2m() {
00053   //cout << "g2m ctor" << endl;
00054   QMenu* myMenu = new QMenu("gcode");
00055 
00056   QAction* myAction = new QAction ( "Create 3D Model...", this );
00057   myAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+M"));
00058   myAction->setStatusTip ( "Load a .ngc file and create a 3d model" );
00059   connect(myAction,SIGNAL(triggered()),this,SLOT(slotModelFromFile()));
00060   myMenu->addAction( myAction );
00061 
00062   /*
00063   **    // do next: show segments one at a time
00064   **    nextAction = new QAction ( "Do next", this );
00065   **    nextAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+."));
00066   **    nextAction->setStatusTip ( "Do next" );
00067   **    connect(nextAction, SIGNAL(triggered()),this,SLOT(myNextMenuItem()));
00068   **    myMenu->addAction( nextAction );
00069   */
00070 
00071   uio::mb()->insertMenu(uio::hm(),myMenu);
00072   //cout << "g2m ctor end" << endl;
00073   //test();
00074 }

00076 void g2m::test() {
00077   uio::hideGrid();
00078   uio::axoView();
00079   double r = .25;
00080   double len = 3;
00081 
00082   //build half
00083   Handle(Geom_TrimmedCurve) Tc;
00084   double rsqrt = r / sqrt(2.0); //for midpoint of circle
00085   Tc = GC_MakeArcOfCircle (gp_Pnt(r,0,r), gp_Pnt(rsqrt,0,r-rsqrt), gp_Pnt(0,0,0));
00086   TopoDS_Edge Ec = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(Tc);
00087   TopoDS_Edge E1 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(r,0,r), gp_Pnt(r,0,len));
00088   TopoDS_Edge E2 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(0,0,0), gp_Pnt(0,0,len));
00089   TopoDS_Edge E3 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(0,0,len), gp_Pnt(r,0,len));
00090   BRepBuilderAPI_MakeWire wm(Ec,E1,E2,E3);
00091 
00092   BRepBuilderAPI_MakeFace mkF(gp_Pln(gp::XOY()),wm.Wire());
00093   BRepPrimAPI_MakeRevol rev(mkF.Face(),gp::OZ(),M_PI*2.0,true);
00094 
00095   TopoDS_Solid t,c,s;
00096   t = TopoDS::Solid(rev.Shape());
00097   //s = TopoDS::Solid(BRepPrimAPI_MakeBox(gp_Pnt(-1,-1,-1),gp_Pnt(1,1,1)).Solid());
00098   s = TopoDS::Solid(BRepPrimAPI_MakeSphere(gp_Pnt(0,0,r),r).Solid());
00099   //c = TopoDS::Solid(BRepAlgoAPI_Cut(s,t));
00100 
00101   GProp_GProps System;
00102   BRepGProp::VolumeProperties ( t,System );
00103   cout << "Mass " << System.Mass() << endl;
00104 
00105   //if (rev.IsDone()) {
00106     dispShape ds(t);
00107     ds.display();
00108   //} else {
00109 //    dispShape ds(wm.Wire());
00110 //    ds.display();
00111 //  }
00112   uio::fitAll();
00113 }

00158 
00159 void g2m::interpret() {
00160   success = false;
00161   //FIXME: don't hardcode these paths
00162   QString ipath = "/opt/src/emc2/trunk/";
00163   QString interp = ipath + "bin/rs274";
00164   QString iparm = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.var\n";
00165   QString itool = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.tbl\n";
00166   QProcess toCanon;
00167   bool foundEOF;
00168   toCanon.start(interp,QStringList(file));
00169   /**************************************************
00170   Apparently, QProcess::setReadChannel screws with waitForReadyRead() and canReadLine()
00171   So, we just fly blind and assume that there are no errors when we navigate
00172   the interp's "menu", and that it requires no delays.
00173   **************************************************/
00174 
00175   //now give the interpreter the data it needs
00176   toCanon.write("2\n"); //set parameter file
00177   toCanon.write(iparm.toAscii());
00178   toCanon.write("3\n"); //set tool table file
00179   toCanon.write(itool.toAscii());
00180   //can also use 4 and 5
00181 
00182   toCanon.write("1\n"); //start interpreting
00183   //cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00184 
00185   if (!toCanon.waitForReadyRead(1000) ) {
00186     if ( toCanon.state() == QProcess::NotRunning ){
00187       infoMsg("Interpreter died.  Bad tool table " + itool + " ?");
00188     } else  infoMsg("Interpreter timed out for an unknown reason.");
00189     cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00190     cout << "stdout: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardOutput() << endl;
00191     toCanon.close();
00192     return;
00193   }
00194 
00195   //if readLine is used at the wrong time, it is possible to pick up a line fragment! will canReadLine() fix that?
00196   qint64 lineLength;
00197   char line[260];
00198   uint fails = 0;
00199   do {
00200     if (toCanon.canReadLine()) {
00201       lineLength = toCanon.readLine(line, sizeof(line));
00202       if (lineLength != -1 ) {
00203         foundEOF = processCanonLine(line);
00204       } else {  //shouldn't get here!
00205         fails++;
00206         sleepSecond();
00207     }
00208   } else {
00209     fails++;
00210     sleepSecond();
00211   }
00212 } while ( (fails < 100) &&
00213 ( (toCanon.canReadLine()) || ( toCanon.state() != QProcess::NotRunning ) )  );
00214 //((lineLength > 0) ||  //loop until interp quits and all lines are read.
00215 //toCanon.canReadLine() ||
00216 success = foundEOF;
00217 return;
00218 }
00219 
00220 bool g2m::processCanonLine (std::string l) {
00221   static bool first = true;  //first line? if so, init status...
00222   //create the object and get its pointer
00223   canonLine * cl;
00224   if (first) {
00225     cl = canonLine::canonLineFactory (l,machineStatus(gp_Ax1(gp_Pnt(0,0,0),gp_Dir(0,0,1))));
00226     first = false;
00227   } else {
00228     cl = canonLine::canonLineFactory (l,*(lineVector.back())->getStatus());
00229   }
00230   //store it
00231   lineVector.push_back(cl);
00232   return cl->checkErrors();
00233 }
00234 
00235 void g2m::sleepSecond() {
00236   //sleep 1s and process events
00237   //cout << "SLEEP..." << endl;
00238   QTime dieTime = QTime::currentTime().addSecs(1);
00239   while( QTime::currentTime() < dieTime )
00240     QCoreApplication::processEvents(QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents, 100);
00241   return;
00242 }
00243 
00244 void g2m::infoMsg(QString s) {
00245   cout << s.toStdString() << endl;
00246 }
